heroku:
**Setting up the bot in heroku**
  Heroku is a Free cloud system for you to host your bot 24/7
  <https://www.heroku.com/>
  ```py
  (1) Fork the Github Repository at <https://github.com/kyb3r/selfbot.py>
  (2) Create an account at <https://www.heroku.com/>
  (3) Go to New and click Create an App (Top Right)
  (4) Give your app a name 
  (5) Click Next 
  (6) Go to Deploy and click Connect to Github
  (7) Sign in to your Github account and type selfbot
  (8) Connect to your repository
  (9) Click Enable Automatic Deploys and Deploy Branch
  (10) Go to Settings and click Reveal Config Vars
  (11) Enter TOKEN in Key and put in your discord token into the Value, Click Add
  (12) Enter PREFIX in Key and put in your desired prefix into the Value, Click Add
  (12b) Can also add COLOR in Key, and enter a hex colour in Value like #423098 if your avatar is transparent
  (13) Go to Resources and click on the Pencil Icon at the row called worker
  (14) Switch worker on, if you cannot see it, refresh the page
  (15) Your bot should be up and running!```
  <https://github.com/kyb3r/selfbot.py>
change-token:
***Oh shit, you leaked your token!***

  In some way or another, you have just given your token away.
  This is not a good thing, as it gives anyone access to the user for that token!
  You can reset your token in a couple of ways:

  **For bot accounts:**
  Go to your app page <https://discordapp.com/developers/applications/me and generate a new token there.

  **For user accounts:**
  Either change your password, or enable/disable 2fa. Either one will change your user token.
hosting:
**Need to run your bot 24/7? Get a cheap VPS.**

  <https://www.scaleway.com/> - Incredibly cheap but powerful VPSes, owned by <https://online.net/>, based in Europe.
  <https://www.digitalocean.com/> - US-based cheap VPSes. The gold standard. Locations available world wide.
  <https://www.ovh.co.uk/> - Cheap VPSes, used by many people. France and Canadian locations available.
  <https://www.time4vps.eu/> - Cheap VPSes, seemingly based in Lithuania.
  <https://www.linode.com/> - More cheap VPSes!
  <https://www.vultr.com/> - US-based, DigitalOcean-like.

  **Self-hosting:**
  Any modern hardware should work 100% fine.

  **Free hosting:**
  A potential solution for hosting your bot 24/7 for free is with a service called Heroku: <https://heroku.com/>
  But beware, this service has an ephemeral file system, which means that files reset to the state that they got pushed to the servers every 24 hours. This makes it unreliable for bots that save data.

update:
**Updating your Self Bot on Heroku**

  ```py
  You don't have to update manually your Selfbot anymore, as there's a new update command, it only requires you to get your GitHub token and add it as a Key variable called GITHUBTOKEN in your Heroku Config Vars tab. For a full tutorial use command
  update-command  
  ```
  **This legacy guide isn't required once you have setup your GitHub token and use the update command**

  `1.` Delete your old repository from <https://github.com/YOUR_USER_NAME_HERE/selfbot.py> > Settings tab
  `2.` ReFork the repository at <https://github.com/kyb3r/selfbot.py/fork
  `3.` Go to your Heroku application > Deploy
  `4.` Disconnect from Github
  `5.` Refresh the page
  `6.` Connect to selfbot.py > Rewrite
  `7.` Click Enable Automatic Deploys and Deploy Branch

  You have updated your selfbot! 😃

support:
***Self Bot Support***

  This a place where you can get yourself a self bot & Enjoy And you can help others !

  ***Rules***
  ```py
  (1) No spamming, even just saying the same thing over and over again.
  (2) No invite links in chat, unless its related to discussion. 
  (3) Respect one another, inappropriate use of words will not be tolerated
  (4) No abuse of bot commands, please call them in the right channels. 
  (5) No invitation of malicious bots, mass DM bots will get you and your bot banned.
  (6) No NSFW, 18+, or erotic types of art or content.
  (7) Absolutely no help vampires allowed. No exceptions.
  *Failure to follow the rules will result in a punishment (mute/warn/kick/ban).*```

  ***Related Servers:***
  Pycord Discord Server | <https://discord.gg/Q8kuctn>
  Code Grok Discord Server | https://discord.gg/Q8kuctn
  SelfBot Discord Server | https://discord.gg/3YWrcke

  ***Related Links:***
  Grok Github | <https://github.com/grokkers/grokbot>
  Self Bot GitHub | <https://github.com/kyb3r/selfbot.py>
  Mod Mail GitHub | <https://github.com/kyb3r/modmail>
android-token:
**How to get Token on your Android, without PC**
  `1.` Download this (link below) from the Google Play Store
  `2.` Press the> icon at the top right
  `3.` Type in discordapp.com/login
  `4.` Log in
  `5.` Press the 3 dots at the top right and click XHR Logs
  `6.` You should see this
  ```py
  REQ:https://discordapp.com/api/v6/auth/mfa/totp
  ARG:{"0":{"isTrusted":true}}
  REAP:{"token":"your token here"}  ```
  `7.` Copy your token

  App to download: <https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=ai.agusibrahim.xhrlog>
android-heroku:
**Setting up the bot in heroku using your Phone**
  Heroku is a Free cloud system for you to host your bot 24/7
  <https://www.heroku.com/>
  ```py
  (1) On your phone, force Desktop Site view
  (2) Fork the Github Repository at <https://github.com/kyb3r/selfbot.py>
  (3) Create an account at <https://www.heroku.com/>
  (3) Go to New and click Create an App (Top Right)
  (4) Give your app a name 
  (5) Click Next 
  (6) Go to Deploy and click Connect to Github
  (7) Sign in to your Github account and type selfbot
  (8) Connect to your repository
  (9) Go to deploy (third icon from left to right), Enable Automatic Deploys
  (10) Scroll down and Deploy Branch Rewrite
  (10) Go to Settings and click Reveal Config Vars
  (11) Rotate your device if you do not see Settings
  (12) Enter TOKEN in Key and put in your discord token into the Value, Click Add
  (13) Enter PREFIX in Key and put in your desired prefix into the Value, Click Add
  (13b) Can also add COLOR in Key, and enter a hex colour in Value like #423098 if your avatar is transparent
  (14) Go to Resources (Second tab from left to right) and refresh the page (swipe down)
  (15) click on the Pencil Icon at the row called worker
  (16) Switch worker on, if you cannot see it, refresh the page
  (17) Your bot should be up and running!```
  <https://github.com/kyb3r/selfbot.py>
github-token:
**How to get your GitHub Token**
  ```py
  This token will be used to update your Selfbot with the `update` command.  ```
  `1.` Go to <https://github.com/settings/tokens>
  `2.` Create a token, and [√] tick everything (call it whatever you want)
  `3.` Copy the token [Ctrl+C]
